thread.title: How pink is the new 'rose gold' iPhone 6S? | Technology
thread.title_full: How pink is the new 'rose gold' iPhone 6S? | Technology | The Guardian

author: Samuel Gibbs
title: How pink is the new 'rose gold' iPhone 6S? | Technology
text:
How pink is the new 'rose gold' iPhone 6S? Not much is new about Apple’s iPhone 6S, but it does come in a new colour. But is it baby pink? Salmon pink? Hot pink? Or maybe blood orange? We wish it would make its mind up, but whatever the colour, it certainly doesn’t look like ‘rose gold’ (whatever that is)
Samuel Gibbs 
@SamuelGibbs Friday 25 September 2015 16.28 BST 
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Share on Pinterest Share on Google+ Share on WhatsApp How pink is your phone ? (How pink, how pink is your phone?) … I’m here all week.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close The darker the background the lighter it looks: baby pink on a metallic pink shirt.
Photograph: Hannah Jane Parkinson for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close It looks a bit more like gold when next to something like a baby pink tie, but we’re not exactly talking rose gold here.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close I’ve eaten salmon that looks this shade of pink. It was responsibly sourced.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close The pinker the background, the pinker the phone – is the iPhone 6S a chameleon?
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close This is the photo that shows the phone as it like it does in real life, a kind of darker metallic pink that induces a type of marmite reaction – some love it, and some just think it’s disgusting.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close The pink compact camera v the pink smartphone camera, which put it and its brethren out to pasture. It looks angry.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close Hot pink makes it look much darker, almost brown.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close But compared to gold, it’s baby – almost Barbie – pink.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close Then again, it looks a bit dark and dull next to this hot-pink notebook.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close And forget about the baby pink Cadillac. It looks almost orange on the edge.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close You’re sure you wanted that non-farmed salmon colour, right?
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Share Share this post Facebook Twitter Pinterest close This is the closest to the claimed ‘rose gold’ we managed to get, against the dark pink of Guardian review.
Photograph: Samuel Gibbs for the Guardian
